timings.name: Safety Review Committee review before titration (data through Day 23)
Second intake/output collection period (covers 15 mg then 30 mg)
timings.valueLabel: Second intake/output collection period (covers 15 mg then 30 mg)

timings.name: Outpatient discharge possible (from CRU) after Day 9
Return/re-admission to CRU for Treatment Period 2 (Day 22 or Day 23 predose); procedures start Day 23
timings.valueLabel: Return/re-admission to CRU for Treatment Period 2 (Day 22 or Day 23 predose); procedures start Day 23

timings.name: Inpatient Period 2 duration (remain in house until Day 40)
timings.valueLabel: Inpatient Period 2 duration (remain in house until Day 40)

timings.name: Predose PK/PD sampling window during 15 mg dosing (Days 4-7)
timings.valueLabel: Predose PK/PD sampling window during 15 mg dosing (Days 4-7)

timings.name: Predose PK/PD sampling window at 15 mg steady state (Days 26-28)
timings.valueLabel: Predose PK/PD sampling window at 15 mg steady state (Days 26-28)

timings.name: Predose PK/PD sampling window during 30 mg dosing (Days 30-38)
timings.valueLabel: Predose PK/PD sampling window during 30 mg dosing (Days 30-38)

timings.name: Predose PK samples collected during intake/output collection periods (general rule)
timings.valueLabel: Predose PK samples collected during intake/output collection periods (general rule)

timings.name: Laboratory assessments performed on specified days only
timings.valueLabel: Laboratory assessments performed on specified days only

timings.name: Overnight fast before dosing while in CRU
Serum chemistry fasting duration at Screening and at check-in
Maximum duration catheter may be left in place
Urine void encouraged within 2 hours of completion of each 24-hour period
Female pregnancy testing frequency (home or site) throughout study
Zinc washout minimum prior to Day 1
Chelator therapy discontinued prior to initiating ALXN1840 (approximate)
Experimental/unapproved therapy washout before Screening (90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever longer)
Disallowed prescription medication washout before Day -7 (14 days or 5 half-lives, whichever longer)
Disallowed nonprescription medication washout before Day -7 (7 days or 5 half-lives, whichever longer)
Alcohol abstinence before study intervention administration
Alexion notification timeframe for clinically concerning lab/vital sign/ECG abnormality or AE
Dose increase timing rationale (after approximately 4 weeks at 15 mg/day)
Steady state expectation based on half-life (Day 10)

conditions.name: Titration safety review requirement
conditions.description: SRC reviews available safety data through Day 23 before titration to 30 mg/day
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period extension requires Investigator approval
conditions.description: Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to 14 additional days with Investigator approval
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: Remain on 15 mg/day if safety concerns
conditions.description: Participants may remain on 15 mg/day for duration of study if safety concerns in opinion of Investigator(s) and/or Alexion
conditions.text: Increase to 30 mg after 4 weeks, unless there are safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk, in which case, participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study.

conditions.name: Eligibility: zinc washout
conditions.description: Must be off zinc therapy for minimum 21 days prior to Day 1
conditions.text: Participants must be off zinc therapy for a minimum of 21 days prior to Day 1.

conditions.name: Eligibility: prior ALXN1840/tetrathiomolybdate exposure
conditions.description: Exclusion if prior ALXN1840 or tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing
conditions.text: Previous treatment with ALXN1840 or other form of tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing.

conditions.name: Eligibility: experimental therapy timing
conditions.description: Exclusion for experimental/unapproved therapy within 90 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) prior to Screening
conditions.text: The use of an experimental or unapproved/unlicensed therapy at the same time or within 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to the Screening Visit.

conditions.name: Disallowed concomitant medications timing
conditions.description: Must abstain from prescription meds within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) of Day -7; nonprescription within 7 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before Day -7 until follow-up completion
conditions.text: Participants must abstain from taking prescription medications within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) of Day -7 or nonprescription drugs... within 7 days or 5 half-lives... before Day -7 and until completion of the follow-up visit.

conditions.name: Dose modification trigger: bilirubin and ALT
conditions.description: Bilirubin >2x ULN accompanied by ALT >3x ULN indicative of liver injury triggers temporary interruption; weekly repeat testing; rechallenge only with approval and when bilirubin below ULN at 15 mg QOD or less frequent
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2  ULN accompanied by ALT > 3  ULN... Temporary interruption; Weekly repeat testing; Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when bilirubin is below ULN; requires approval of the Alexion Medical Monitor.

conditions.name: Dose modification trigger: neurologic worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or neurologic exam prompts evaluation with Medical Monitor for dose modification; must document and follow until completion/resolution
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification... All neurologic worsening should be documented as AEs and followed up until study completion or resolution.

conditions.name: Dose modification trigger: psychiatric worsening
conditions.description: Clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening (including suicidality, acute depression, psychosis) prompts evaluation for dose modification; document as AE and follow until completion/resolution
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification... followed until completion of the study or resolution.

conditions.name: Rechallenge limit after dose modification
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention considerations for ECG changes
conditions.description: Clinically significant finding including QTcF changes after enrollment requires determination if participant can continue
conditions.text: If a clinically significant finding is identified (including... QTcF) after enrollment, the Investigator... will determine if the participant can continue in the study...

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if serious hypersensitivity reaction
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Serious hypersensitivity reaction.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if severe uncontrolled infection
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Severe uncontrolled infection.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if use of disallowed medication
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Use of disallowed medication.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if pregnancy or planned pregnancy
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention at Alexion/Investigator discretion
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation if Alexion or Investigator deems necessary
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Alexion or the Investigator deems it is necessary for the participant.

conditions.name: Lost to follow-up determination process
conditions.description: Before deeming lost to follow-up, make every effort including 3 telephone calls and if necessary a certified letter; if unreachable then considered withdrawn
conditions.text: Before a participant is deemed lost to follow-up... (where possible, 3 telephone calls and, if necessary, a certified letter)... Should the participant continue to be unreachable, he/she will be considered to have withdrawn from the study.

conditions.name: Adaptive design allowance
conditions.description: Adaptive features may be implemented at Investigator discretion; no protocol amendment required; limits described elsewhere (Table 4 not provided here)
conditions.text: This study incorporates the use of an adaptive design. Adaptive features may be implemented at the discretion of the Investigator... do not require amendment of the protocol.

transitionRules.name: Run-in to Treatment initiation
transitionRules.text: Following screening and enrollment, participants will have a Run-in Period... Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 (Day 1).

transitionRules.name: Dose titration 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day on Day 29 contingent on safety review
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day on Day 1 through Day 28 and then increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29... Before titration... SRC will review safety data through Day 23.

transitionRules.name: Remain on 15 mg/day for duration if safety concerns
transitionRules.text: Increase to 30 mg after 4 weeks, unless there are safety concerns... in which case, participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study.

transitionRules.name: Temporary interruption for suspected liver injury pattern
transitionRules.text: Bilirubin > 2  ULN accompanied by ALT > 3  ULN... Temporary interruption; weekly repeat testing; rechallenge only when bilirubin below ULN at 15 mg QOD or less frequent with Medical Monitor approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose modification evaluation for neurologic worsening
transitionRules.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease)... re-evaluated at the next study visit.

transitionRules.name: Dose modification evaluation for psychiatric worsening
transitionRules.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification... re-evaluated at the next study visit.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of study intervention for safety/administrative triggers
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if any of the following occur: serious hypersensitivity reaction; severe uncontrolled infection; use of disallowed medication; pregnancy or planned pregnancy; or Alexion or the Investigator deems it is necessary.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of study intervention for abnormal liver function (per dose modification criteria or best interest)
transitionRules.text: Discontinuation of study intervention for abnormal liver function should be considered when a participant meets one of the conditions outlined in the Dose Modification criteria... or if the Investigator believes it is in best interest of the participant.

transitionRules.name: Participant withdrawal/discontinuation from study
transitionRules.text: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time... or may be withdrawn... for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons; early discontinuation visit should be conducted if possible.

transitionRules.name: Lost to follow-up to withdrawn status
transitionRules.text: Before deemed lost to follow-up, make every effort (3 telephone calls and if necessary certified letter). If unreachable, participant will be considered to have withdrawn from the study.

transitionRules.name: Post-study therapy transition after completion of inpatient periods (Day 40)
transitionRules.text: Following completion of both inpatient periods (ie, Day 40), participants will transition to discontinued therapy, other standard of care, or may request continuation of ALXN1840 under preapproval access per local regulations.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study completion definition
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant completes all phases including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early discontinuation visit on study withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: At time of discontinuation from the study, if possible, an early discontinuation visit should be conducted as shown in the SoA.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Definitive study intervention discontinuation but remain in study for safety follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: If study intervention is definitively discontinued, participant should remain in the study to be evaluated for safety follow-up (per SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor termination/closure of site or study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion may close a site or terminate the study at any time for any reason; early site closure reasons include noncompliance, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of development.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: SRC titration decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision whether participant can titrate from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day on Day 29 based on safety data through Day 23 and overall safety concerns.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Outpatient Period extension decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator decision to extend outpatient period up to 14 additional days.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose interruption/rechallenge decision for liver injury pattern
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to interrupt dosing, perform weekly repeats, and potentially rechallenge (max 3) with Medical Monitor approval when criteria met.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Neurologic worsening dose adjustment decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator/Medical Monitor decision for interruption/increase/decrease based on copper control parameters and clinical data; re-evaluate next visit.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Psychiatric worsening dose adjustment decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator/Medical Monitor decision for interruption/increase/decrease; re-evaluate next visit.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Study intervention discontinuation decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to consider discontinuation of study intervention upon specified triggers.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Lost-to-follow-up withdrawal decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to classify participant as lost to follow-up/withdrawn after required documented contact attempts.
